page.title: 16WHERE WE PLAY IN HORNSEA
page.content: We conducted a survey among approximately 170 children from Hornsea Primary School to find out where they went to play in their spare time. The majority of the younger children played in their own garden or at a friend's house. This is probably because their parents thought this was safer. Not many of the younger children were allowed to play in the street, in the park or on the beach. The park was a popular place to play for the older children. Nearly 55% of ten year olds and over 30% of nine and eleven year olds said that the park was the place where they most often played. Only between 5% and 15% of the children between 7 and 11 years old were allowed to play on the beach. ELEANOR ANDERSON 5.G.
